summary: Sangria is a traditional alcoholic drink from Spain and Portugal, made with red wine and fruit. It's often served in clay pitchers and is popular with tourists. Only these two countries can call their drink "Sangria" by EU rules. Similar drinks in other places have different names, like "Cleric√≥" in Latin America. Even though it's famous worldwide, locals in Spain and Portugal don't drink it as much as visitors.
title: Sangria
